lines.text: You don't seem to have much riding practice.
What makes you say that?
You keep falling off your horse!
I've had plenty of practice at THAT, plenty of practice!
I don't want to meet mad people...
But you can't help it. Everyone here is mad. I'm mad. You're mad. It's only by chance n' careful planning if you're not!
How do you know I'M mad?

[disappearing]
Because you're here, and everyone here is mad!
[Alice arrives at the Mad Tea Party]
I'm lost. Could I get some - ?
No room!
There's no room!

[indignant]
There's *plenty* of room!
Why didn't you report this sooner, Hatty?
I overslept!

[in an encouraging tone]
Have some wine.

[looking down the table]
I don't see any wine.
There isn't any. And you're too young.
Then it wasn't very nice of you to offer it.
It wasn't very nice of *you* to sit down without an invitation! This is a *private* soirée.
Well, I suppose I shouldn't have just barged in when I know I wasn't invited. But the table was laid out for a lot of people.
get your hair cut!
[Tweedledum and Tweedledee offer to tell Alice a story]
I'm sorry, I don't have the time...
Neither do we! We never carry a watch!

[singing]
Auntie's wooden leg...
I say, I say, I say...
How dare you interrupt my song with "I say, I say, I say!"
I say, I say, I say in this world it's now what you know but WHOM you know!
I don't know either one of them!

[singing]
Twinkle, twinkle, little bat, / How I wonder what you're at / Up above the world so high / Like a tea tray in the sky...
Officer, these men are criminals!
Who's got his ear trumpet?
[Alice bangs on the door to the Duchess's palace]
It's no good your knocking like that.
Why not?
because I'm on the same side of the door as you.
Oh, yes...
they're making so much noise inside no one can hear you.

[thinking about the riddle]
Why is a raven like a writing desk... you know, I-I'm pretty sure I can guess.
You mean you think you know the answer?
Yes.
Well, then, you should say what you mean.
Well, I do. At-at least, at least I mean what I say, that-that is the same thing.
It's not the same thing at all. You might as well say "I eat what I see" is the same thing as "I see what I eat!"
[a pie sprouts crab legs and crawls across the table]

[eyeing the pie, picking up a fly swatter]
You might as well say "I like what I get" is the same as "I get what I like!"
[whacks the pie]

[talking in his sleep, then suddenly awake]
Aah! You-you, or you might as well say "I breathe when I sleep" is the same thing as "I sleep when I breathe."
[nods off]
Well, it is the same thing with you.
[chuckles]

[looking at his watch]
What day of the month is it?
The fourth.
Aha! Two days wrong!
[glares at the March Hare]
I told you not to use butter!
It was the best butter.
Danish, mmm.
Some crumbs must have got into it as well. I said, don't put butter in the works with a bread knife!
I couldn't put it in with a fork, could I? Here, let me see...

[capricious]
I don't want to *give* it to you, but I will!

[the Hare takes the watch and examines it; first by banging it on the table, and then by dipping it into his teacup]
I don't understand it. It was the best butter.
Danish.

[the Hare tosses the watch over to Alice, who picks it up and studies it]
It's a funny watch. It tells the day of the month, but not the time.
Why should it? Does your watch tell you what year it is?
No, because it stays a year for so long.
Oh then, I rest my case.
Where?

[points to a pile of suitcases]
There.
Well, then, I rest my case!
Where?

[points to a pile of suitcases]
There.
[breaks into laughter]

[dully]
I know when I'm beaten.
[the Mock Turtle begins his tale]
Once...
[starts moaning and wringing his hands]
I was once a real turtle...
[breaks down completely]

[rises to leave]
Thank you for that very interesting story...
I haven't started yet!

[half-pleading]
Stay! You may learn something!
I think carefully before acting rashly.
Sound advice.
I was an advisor to the British army.
I advised them not to take him, but they wouldn't listen.
Personal remarks are rude?
Mm-hmm.
Egad, you learn something new every day. Make a note of that, Marchy, it might come in useful.

[nervously]
Lovely day, Your Majesty...
either you or your head must be OFF!
[Faced with such a proposal, the Duchess decides to take off]
When Griff and I were little, we went to school in the same sea. And the master was an old turtle; we used to call him "tortoise."
Why would you call him tortoise if he wasn't one?
We called him "tortoise" because he "taught us."
You ought to be ashamed of yourself! Asking a simple question like that.
I see you're admiring my box. It's my own invention, to keep sandwiches in. You see, I carry it upside-down so they don't get wet when it rains.
...But they can drop out. The lid is open.
So, THAT's what happened to my sandwiches.
What are they doing? They can't have anything to write; the trial hasn't even begun yet.
They're writing down their own names in case they forget them by the time the trial is over.
Stupid things.
Stupid... how do you spell "stupid"?
Uhhh, S... T... what comes after T?
Dinner.
Is it dinner time? It's dinner time!
You have to tread with care when dealing with cats, they have influence and are seen in all the smart places.
Cedric! You must cross-examine the witness!

[sigh]
Oh, must I?
Yes, Cedric, be a man.

[sigh]
Oh, all right.
Time marches on its stomach! Ah-haha!
It's an army that marches on its stomach!
Odd sort of army, marching on its stomach. I don't like the idea, yuck!
I went to a hunting party once, I didn't like it. Terrible people. They all started hunting me!
Life must be hard for you.
But I grin and bear it!
Waiter, waiter, there's a HARE in my soup!
Is it blonde? We're missing a waitress!
Now, I have one for you.
Ooh!
Why is a raven like a writing table?
Why is a raven...?
I'm not talking to *you*?
Why not? Aren't I good enough?
You've heard it before.
But you were looking at *me* when you said, "Why is a raven like a writing..."

[angry]
I'm asking Alice!
Just be brave, and always get back on your horse!

[to Alice]
You look worried. You're too young to worry.
[some talking daisies insult Alice]
If you're not quiet, I'll make you into a chain!
[the daisies shut up]
Hello! Who are you?
Alice.
Alice... a charming misnomer.
And you are...?
A Griffin! Part eagle, part lion - the best of each, I always say!
I thought you were a mythical creature.
I am! That makes me even more fffffascinating!

[falling down the rabbit hole]
I wonder what latitude or longitude I've gotten to? I've no idea what latitude or longitude are, but they're grand words. Longitude, latitude...
I'm not staying here listening for you to be rude.
You'll find better places for that, I'm sure.
If you drink too much from a bottle marked "poison," it's almost certain to disagree with you sooner or later.
Why am I here?
To save Jack from a death worse than fate!
Oh Tiger Lily, I wish you could talk so you could tell me how to get out of this wood.
I can talk, when there's anybody worth talking to!
I am NOT in the habit of talking to myself.
[aside]
Even though it's the only way I can get a decent conversation around here.
How can you keep talking like that?
Like what?
Head downwards, and body in the air!
What does it matter where my head and body are? My mind goes on working just the same...
How're you enjoying the game?
They don't play very fair.
No one does if they think they can get away with it. That's a lesson you'll have to learn.
Well, all's well that ends well...
What is THAT?
[points at a broken rattle]
Would you stop grumping like that? You sound as if you've turned into a pig... you HAVE turned into a pig! I'd better let you go...
[trying to stuff the Dormouse into a teapot]
I told you he wouldn't fit!
Oh, he'll fit! We just have to push harder!
Curiouser and curiouser...
How do we get rid of a floating cat?
Off with its head!
Brilliant!
[repeated line]
Off with your head!
When I used to read about fairy tales, I never thought I would end up in the middle of one. There ought to be a story written about me. Perhaps one day, when I've grown up, I'll write one...
[the Cheshire Cat grins at the King of Hearts, vexing him]
A cat may look at a king.
Where did you get that?
I read it in a book.
I haven't. But I don't like it. It has undertones. That book should be banned.
[about the Mock Turtle]
He's my best friend. True blue, true and true...
Mock, tell this young girl about yourself!
You've come to the right person. Sit down, both of you...
No, thanks, I've heard it before...
Sit down! It's the least you can do!
Is your hair fixed on your head right?
Only in the usual way.
Well, that's not good enough! The wind around here is as strong as soup!
Oh my furry ears and whiskers, look how late it's getting!
[rushes off]
Ooh!

[voiceover, as she watches the White Rabbit rush off, then slowly follows him]
Perhaps I fell right *through* the earth, then - came out the other side. Yet, I'll have to ask somebody the name of the country. "Please, ma'am, is this New Zealand or Australia?"

[playing Flamingo-Hedgehog Croquet]
It's pointless, everybody's cheating!
People do, if they think they can get away with it.

[on trial for stealing tarts]
I confess! I didn't do it!
lines.character: Sir Jack, the Knave of Hearts
